Social and computer scientists are engaged in efforts to study the complex mix of cognitive, social, and algorithmic biases that make us vulnerable to manipulation by online misinformation
11 . These include information overload and finite attention
12 , novelty of false news
2 , the selective exposure
13– 15 caused by polarized and segregated online social networks
16, 17 , algorithmic popularity bias
18– 20 , and other cognitive vulnerabilities such as confirmation bias and motivated reasoning
21– 23 .
